Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on the fundamental human right to free speech.
The definition of 'misinformation' is subjective, particularly regarding what constitutes 'harm'.
The bill represents an extreme form of government overreach into personal expression.
There is a concern about increasing restrictions on speech in Australia over recent years.
Notable Quotes: It is truly a privilege to be human and no government has the right to disempower or interfere with such an integral aspect of our human experience, the right to hold beliefs and express them.
Free speech is a non-negotiable human right and must be safeguarded.
It is simply not possible for governments to police such subjectivity.
